item.title: On the Misuse of Language
item.description: This post concerns the question of whether spoken and written languages like English could be logically consistent by design, and why they aren’t. It turns out there’s two ways we can ask (and answer) this question. The first does not require a mathematical background whatsoever, whereas the second touches on the concepts of axioms, theorems and proofs. Both parts are somewhat self-contained, so you can skip to part 2 if you’d like.
